intro: Couepia carautae, commonly known as the Carauta couepia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, alternate leaves, and showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
